data.title: Montefiore Medical Center
meta_keywords: montefiore medical center bronx heart cardiology cancer urology transplant neurosurgery
data.meta_description: Montefiore Medical Center, the University Hospital for Albert Einstein College of Medicine, is a premier academic medical center and nationally recognized leader in patient care, research and community service located in the Bronx, New York.
data.text:
Montefiore Einstein Premieres New State-of-the-Art Specialty Pharmacy in Westchester, Accelerating Access to Life-Altering Medications

The 17,000-square-foot facility is accelerating access to life-altering medications and is one of the largest and most technologically advanced hospital-owned specialty pharmacies in the region. Setting a new standard of care, the facility provides complex medications to Montefiore Einstein patients with rare and chronic conditions while tackling financial barriers. Learn more >

Structural Heart Program Launches Offering Minimally Invasive Heart Valve Replacement Procedures

Renowned Montefiore Einstein interventional cardiologists are now performing lifesaving transcatheter aortic valve replacements (TAVR) at White Plains Hospital—close to home for Westchester patients. Learn more >

Albert Einstein College of Medicine Goes Tuition-Free in Perpetuity for Medical Students

A historic gift will ensure that no medical student at Montefiore’s Albert Einstein College of Medicine will have to pay tuition again. Dr. Philip O. Ozuah, President and CEO of Montefiore Einstein, announced that Albert Einstein College of Medicine has received this transformational gift—the largest to any medical school in the country—from Ruth L. Gottesman, EdD, Chair of the Einstein Board of Trustees, Montefiore Health System Board Member, and Professor Emerita of Pediatrics at Albert Einstein College of Medicine. We are profoundly grateful to Dr. Gottesman. Watch now >

2024 Oscar Nominee Emily Blunt Presents AIS Honor to Dr. Philip Ozuah

2024 Oscar nominee Emily Blunt presents the AIS Freeing Voices, Changing Lives Award to Dr. Philip O. Ozuah, President and CEO of Montefiore Einstein. Watch the story that is inspiring people around the world. Dr. Ozuah shares his unlikely journey from intern to CEO, and how embracing the stutter is a gift. Watch >

A Promising New Approach Targets Dormant Yet Deadly Cancer Cells

Researchers at Montefiore Einstein Comprehensive Cancer Center built on their earlier discovery of a signaling pathway that enables survival of dormant cancer cells, successfully deploying an experimental drug to disrupt it and prevent metastases. Learn more >

The Balance with Dr. Ozuah Returns for Its Second Season on the YES Network

From a mysterious condition to life-changing diagnoses, Dr. Philip O. Ozuah, President and CEO, Montefiore Einstein, takes us on a new health and wellness journey. Featured on the YES Network; watch on YouTube and subscribe.

Albert Einstein College of Medicine Scientists Lead Groundbreaking Search for Genetic Keys to Long, Healthy Life

In the first research program of its kind, researchers have scanned the entire genomes of centenarians in search of genetic secrets to long, healthy lives and so far have identified 15 longevity gene variants. Their findings could help extend the human “health span”—the length of time people live without experiencing chronic or debilitating diseases. Learn more >

A New Lung Gave Paul More Life

Paul Rivera has always loved working with his hands, and carpentry is his passion. But when a persistent cough left him weakened and exhausted, Paul feared he would have to hang up his tools for good. Learn more >

Learn More >

Montefiore Einstein Partners with Findhelp to link our Patients and Community Members with Social Resources

Montefiore Einstein patients and community members can enter their zip code in Findhelp to find resources for food, housing, utility and financial assistance, as well as transportation and other services. Findhelp has over 15,000 available programs and 3000 featured community-based programs. Visit Montefiore Einstein’s Findhelp site now to start exploring the available reduced-cost services >

Locations

Montefiore Health System is comprised of 10 member hospitals and more than 200 outpatient ambulatory care sites that provide coordinated, comprehensive care to patients and their families across the Bronx, Westchester and the Hudson Valley.

Find a location near you to get the care you need.

Moses Campus

Children s Hospital at Montefiore (CHAM)

Weiler Hospital (Einstein)

Wakefield Campus

Hutchinson Campus
